page.title: 08WILD LIFE IN S.ELKINGTON
page.content: Many birds and animals visit or reside in the area, attracted by the wood, water,and hedgerows,which create cover and a regular food supply.{Resident {breeding birds}include:-blackbird, wren,goldcrest,pied wagtail, greater spotted woodpecker, yellow hammer, mistle and song thrush,bull and gold finches, chaffinches, great,blue and coal tits,kestrel, sparrow-hawk, barn and tawny owls. {Game birds}_ woodcock red-legged and gray patridge,pheasant. {Summer Visitors}_ cuckoo,swift,house and sand martins,swallow,chiff-chaff, spotted fly-catcher. {Winter visitors} redwing,fieldfare,brambling,siskins, and wild fowl such as potyard, teal, tufted duck,Canada geese.{Wild animals rabbits and grey squirrels,fox, mole, hedgehog,field vole,harvest mice and badger.{Wild flowers}-wild garlic, early purple and common spotted orchid
